name: serpin family B member 3
other_names: serine (or cysteine) proteinase inhibitor, clade B (ovalbumin), member 3
serpin peptidase inhibitor, clade B (ovalbumin), member 3
summary: Enables cysteine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity; protease binding activity; and virus receptor activity. Involved in several processes, including autocrine signaling; paracrine signaling; and regulation of cellular protein metabolic process. Located in cytoplasmic vesicle; extracellular exosome; and nucleus. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
